body: This is probably because your onedrive administrator hasn't allowed access to files.

It works only if I create my own client id and secret key but if I use the default i.e., rclone's client and secret it will not show the one drive storage instead it will display those 2 storages.
So can you help me out?

> instead it will display those 2 storages.

Yeah, I have suffered the same issue even with my own client id sometimes, specially on newly created account.

If it is a newly created account then create/upload a single file in onedrive via browser, after that try rclone, 90% chance it will work. Whenever I face this issue, doing that solved most of the times.
Since I am not the only one who suffers this bug/problem it's definitely not from my side and I can easily use gdrive without creating any client id and secret,so can anyone fix this?
Any ideas? Is this something to do with rclone's default client_id?

> Is this something to do with rclone's default client_id?

No, even with own custom client i get this issue sometimes. I am looking into it.

I'm not sure what is going on here...

Here are the docs for the [/me/drives call](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/onedrive/developer/rest-api/api/drive_list?view=odsp-graph-online#list-the-current-users-drives) and here are the docs for the [/me/drive call](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/onedrive/developer/rest-api/api/drive_get?view=odsp-graph-online#http-request) which returns a single drive for the current user.

I would have thought the data drive would show up in the `drives` list...

If they are going to return different things, then we should probably call `/drive` **and** `/drives` and combine the two (deduplicating on driveID).
Yes, calling both will be the perfect solution.
@Dibbyo456 do I understand from your forum post that this is no longer an issue?

No, this is an different issue. Graph API sometimes unable to return onedrive root document folder, because onedrive hasn't provisioned yet or the api sending cached response.

> then we should probably call `/drive` and `/drives` and combine the two (deduplicating on driveID).

Doing this probably would be the best idea.

I had a go at this - can you have a try?

If you run `rclone config -vv --dump bodies` it will show you the http transactions - please send that if it doesn't work!

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.51.0-126-g7bf37666-fix-4068-onedrive-drives-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Thanks for testing :-)

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.52
